references.paper_title: Asymptotic optimality and asymptotic equipartition properties of log-optimum investment
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for the asymptotic optimality of log-optimum investment strategies, which is relevant to the Sharpe ratio maximization problem.

references.paper_title: Proximal alternating minimization and projection methods for nonconvex problems: An approach based on the Kurdyka-Łojasiewicz inequality
references.reason: This paper introduces the Kurdyka-Łojasiewicz inequality and its application to proximal alternating minimization and projection methods for nonconvex optimization problems, which is crucial for developing the PGA algorithm used in this study.

references.paper_title: Convergence of descent methods for semi-algebraic and tame problems: proximal algorithms, forward-backward splitting, and regularized Gauss-Seidel methods
references.reason: This paper extends the application of the Kurdyka-Łojasiewicz inequality to a wider class of nonconvex problems and provides convergence results for various descent methods, which are essential for analyzing the convergence of the PGA algorithm.
This paper proposes a sparse and stable Markowitz portfolio model, which is directly related to the m-sparse Sharpe ratio maximization problem addressed in this study.

references.paper_title: A parametric linear complementarity technique for optimal portfolio selection with a risk-free asset
references.reason: This paper introduces a parametric linear complementarity technique for solving portfolio optimization problems, which is a fundamental method used in this study's comparative analysis.
